examples: Because honey bees collect pollen.
Bumblebees eat pollen.
That bee does have pollen on its legs.
That leg wipes the pollen right off her eye.
This dust is called pollen.
words.defineEn: the fine spores that contain male gametes and that are borne by an anther in a flowering plant
words.defineVi: các bào tử mịn có chứa giao tử đực và được sinh ra bởi một bao phấn trong thực vật có hoa

examples: Despite accusations that the company was responsible for polluting the lake, it received a clean bill of health from the environmental agency after a thorough investigation.
The oil industry pollutes, significantly.
But the chemical polluted the water in the brown pelican’s habitat.
Global water sources are polluted by excess ammonium nitrate from cornfields.
Such conduct pollutes the water and kills sea life.
words.defineEn: to damage the environment by releasing harmful chemicals or substances to the air, water, or land
words.defineVi: làm hỏng môi trường bằng cách giải phóng các hóa chất hoặc chất độc hại vào không khí, nước hoặc đất

examples: They're gigantic.
The whole thing is one gigantic piece here.
These are gigantic faults.
Oh my God, they're gigantic.

words.defineEn: so exceedingly large or extensive as to suggest a giant or mammoth
words.defineVi: quá lớn hoặc rộng lớn để gợi ý một người khổng lồ hoặc voi ma mút

examples: What a ghoulish uh Listen it's always entertaining to say the least.
words.defineEn: suggesting the horror of death and decay
words.defineVi: cho thấy nỗi kinh hoàng của cái chết và sự suy tàn

examples: My eyes felt dry as dust, gritty, and probably looked as though threaded with varicose veins.
- It's gritty.
No, it's gritty.
It feels way more gritty than the regular sponge.
- Like, you've got some gritty lips, girl.
words.defineVi: sẵn sàng đối mặt với nguy hiểm

examples: With a sharp knife, the chef expertly removed the gristle from the pork chops.
They discovered that the tough texture in their soup was actually gristle from the beef.
It's all gristle, man.
Alright, I'mma go in for the side, 'cause all I got was a little gristle.
words.defineEn: tough elastic tissue; mostly converted to bone in adults
words.defineVi: mô đàn hồi dai; chủ yếu chuyển đổi thành xương ở người lớn

examples: Instead, a narrow strand of cells infiltrates the body of a grapevine, not unlike the roots of those parasitic barnacles.
Just another way monster history infiltrates our real world.
In 2016, Russians infiltrated our voting systems in every single state.
The problem is that the bacteria could have infiltrated the flour during any step of the manufacturing process.
As water infiltrates the gaps of olivine’s crystal structure, it changes into serpentinite.
words.defineEn: enter a group or organization in order to spy on the members
words.defineVi: tham gia một nhóm hoặc tổ chức để theo dõi các thành viên

examples: His ace in the hole is his political influence.
His paintings had a strong influence on me as a student.
Iranian cuisine is influenced by various Asian flavors, making it a delightful fusion of Middle Eastern and Asian culinary traditions.
He saw that his unhealthy habits were influencing his children's behavior, as like breeds like.
They got into trouble with the law for driving under the influence.
words.defineEn: the power or ability to affect or shape the thoughts, actions, or behaviors of others
words.defineVi: sức mạnh hoặc khả năng ảnh hưởng hoặc định hình suy nghĩ, hành động hoặc hành vi của người khác

words.defineEn: a collection or assortment of different items or pieces of writing, often gathered together in a single volume or publication
words.defineVi: một bộ sưu tập hoặc phân loại các mục hoặc bài viết khác nhau, thường được tập hợp lại với nhau trong một tập hoặc ấn phẩm duy nhất

examples: Mrs. Swanson was being driven to distraction by her mischievous son.
Medial frontal cortex damage usually leads to mischievous dominant hands.
But what came up were pictures of cute, mischievous moles.
And yes, he's also a mischievous little creature with a penchant for gold.
But you know they're totally mischievous little rascals.
words.defineEn: displaying a passion for causing trouble in an amusing manner
words.defineVi: thể hiện niềm đam mê gây rắc rối một cách thú vị
bày tỏ sự phản đối mạnh mẽ đối với

examples: And it's reprehensible.
They are irresponsible, but they're also reprehensible.
But today many of us in public life are guilty of a fault less reprehensible though similarly consequential.
words.defineEn: bringing or deserving severe rebuke or censure
words.defineVi: mang lại hoặc xứng đáng bị quở trách hoặc kiểm duyệt nghiêm trọng

examples: The crowd's cheers soon turned into shrieks.
It's apparently shrieking and I can't hear it.
It shrieks, and can run across tree tops and its presence may be preceded by a foul odor, or a sudden snow storm.
Don't ever call her a pundit, because she would shriek at that.
And so I take the shrieking timer and I put it in my better ear, nothing!
words.defineEn: to utter a loud, sharp, piercing cry or sound
words.defineVi: để thốt ra một tiếng kêu lớn, sắc nét, xuyên thấu hoặc âm thanh

examples: Creative people are always sporadic, man.
The Taliban are carrying sporadic attacks.
Eunice Bae is an actress, sporadic short-term gigs, monthly Manhattan rent.
The government says there is sporadic fighting in the region.
There are some statewide initiatives, of course, but they are sporadic.
words.defineEn: occurring from time to time, in an irregular, scattered, and random manner
words.defineVi: xảy ra theo thời gian, không đều, rải rác và ngẫu nhiên

examples: Michelangelo's sculptures and paintings are a testament to the fact that genius is an infinite capacity for taking pains.
The library stands as a testament to the wisdom of generations of teachers who have passed away, reminding us that teachers die but books live on to inspire future learners.
The ancient oak tree stands tall and strong, a testament to its age as old as the hills.
The patterns in Pascal's Triangle are a testament to the elegantly interwoven fabric of mathematics.
These ten films feature dozens of fascinating monsters, each a testament to Harryhausen's vision.
words.defineEn: a legal document declaring a person's wishes regarding the disposal of their property when they die
words.defineVi: một tài liệu pháp lý tuyên bố mong muốn của một người về việc xử lý tài sản của họ khi họ chết

words.defineEn: a person who makes a will

examples: I have hundreds of testimonials from people who have been affected positively by the book.
Then they provide social proof of their authenticity, like hyperbolic testimonials or numbers of followers on Twitter and Instagram.
But that moment, the regiment's ferocious battle for liberty, would be memorialized, in remembrances, testimonials and even in Hollywood in the 1989 film "Glory."
You may recall I gave a testimonial for your product.

But from my own experience and my own testimonial is that he has been on the right side of these issues having to do with race, having to do with integration, having to do with empowerment of Black people.
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó phục vụ như là bằng chứng

words.defineEn: any experience that causes intense suffering
words.defineVi: bất kỳ kinh nghiệm nào gây ra đau khổ dữ dội

examples: Calvinism became even more far-flung than Lutheranism, with communities springing up from the British Isles to Hungary and other parts of eastern European regions.
words.defineEn: the theological system of John Calvin and his followers emphasizing omnipotence of God and salvation by grace alone
words.defineVi: hệ thống thần học của John Calvin và những người theo ông nhấn mạnh đến sự toàn năng của Chúa và sự cứu rỗi chỉ nhờ ân sủng
